Language barriers: If the company has employees or customers in multiple countries, there may be language barriers that make it difficult to communicate about cyber security.
Time zone differences: If the company has employees or customers in multiple time zones, there may be challenges in coordinating cyber security efforts across different time zones.

Different levels of technical expertise: Different countries may have different levels of technical expertise, which can make it difficult to develop a cyber security solution that is accessible to all employees.

Different levels of cyber security awareness: Different countries may have different levels of cyber security awareness, which can make it difficult to educate employees about cyber security best practices.

Different levels of cyber security threats: Different countries may face different levels of cyber security threats, which can make it difficult to develop a solution that is tailored to the specific needs of each country.
